CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03B15

TITLE.P: 75179 AS KLM Avd for medisinsk biokjemi [The Department of Medical Biochemistry], Analysis Machine.

SHORT_DESCR.P: A new immunoassay instrument shall be procured for the Hormone Laboratory, Department of Medical Biochemistry, Oslo University Hospital. The new instrument shall have an analytical method for the determination of antibodies against thyroid hormone receptors (TRAS).

MAIN_SITE.P: Oslo University HF [Oslo University Hospital Health Trust - OUS].

SHORT_DESCR.P: A new immunoassay instrument shall be procured for the Hormone Laboratory, Department of Medical Biochemistry, Oslo University Hospital. The new instrument shall have an analytical method for the determination of antibodies against thyroid hormone receptors (TRAS).
The procurement will be carried out via ex ante transparency notice.
Reasons for the Voluntary ex ante transparency notice:
The analysis instrument has some A-requirements that are important for daily operations.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse both stimulatory and blocking TRAS.
— The analysis instrument must be fully automatic (including pipetting of samples and reagents, incubating, washing, reading and dilution of samples).
— The analysis instrument must be able to carry out immuno-fluorometric methods (IFMA), i.e. the trace molecule is a fluoridising earth metal or equivalent.
— The analysis technique must not be based on biotin and streptavidin marked reagents.
— The analysis instrument must be able to read off positive bar code identification and be able to communicate with LIS.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse >100 samples in each set-up.
— The analysis instrument must be able to be used for multiple analyses simultaneously, also from the same sample.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse standards and make a calibration curve.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse samples, controls and standards.
— The analysis instrument must be able to pipette samples from 13 x 75mm tubes and should be able to use mikrokopper.
— The analysis instrument´s computer systems shall be robust, simple to operate and compatible with existing systems in the laboratory.
— The analysis instrument must have two-way communication with an external computer system. The laboratory uses the data system LabVantage Medical Suit, from Software Point – LabVantage Group.
— The analysis instrument should have a user-friendly statistics programme for registration of controls and calculation of precision and accuracy.
It is also important that the analysis instrument has options to:
— Programme for calculating concentration based on a standard curve.
— The analysis instrument ought to have an interface programme for data transfer of results/checks.
— The analysis instrument should be able to discharge waste directly into the drain.
— The analysis instrument ought to have detection of fluid level.
— The analysis instrument should be able to define durability of all reagents / plates included in the analysis, as well as logging the lot in use.
— Any interferences, for example, from bilirubinemia, lipaemia and hemolysis, must be documented for the analysis.

INFO_ADD.P: This agreement concerns the purchase of 2 Kryptor plus Compact. For kits and other necessary reagents, see the framework agreement 2018xxxxx00.
The framework agreement for kits and other necessary reagents lasts as long as the equipment is in use at Oslo University Hospital or at the trial.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The analysis instrument has some A-requirements that are important for daily operations.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse both stimulatory and blocking TRAS.
— The analysis instrument must be fully automatic (including pipetting of samples and reagents, incubating, washing, reading and dilution of samples).
— The analysis instrument must be able to carry out immuno-fluorometric methods (IFMA), i.e. the trace molecule is a fluoridising earth metal or equivalent.
— The analysis technique must not be based on biotin and streptavidin marked reagents.
— The analysis instrument must be able to read off positive bar code identification and be able to communicate with LIS.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse >100 samples in each set-up.
— The analysis instrument must be able to be used for multiple analyses simultaneously, also from the same sample.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse standards and make a calibration curve.
— The analysis instrument must be able to analyse samples, controls and standards.
— The analysis instrument must be able to pipette samples from 13 x 75mm tubes and should be able to use microcups.
— The analysis instrument´s computer systems shall be robust, simple to operate and compatible with existing systems in the laboratory.
— The analysis instrument must have two-way communication with an external computer system. The laboratory uses the data system LabVantage Medical Suit, from Software Point – Labvantage Group.
— The analysis instrument should have a user-friendly statistics programme for registration of controls and calculation of precision and accuracy.
It is also important that the analysis instrument has options to:
— Programme for calculating concentration based on a standard curve.
— The analysis instrument ought to have an interface programme for data transfer of results/checks.
— The analysis instrument should be able to discharge waste directly into the drain.
— The analysis instrument ought to have detection of fluid level.
— The analysis instrument should be able to define durability of all reagents / plates included in the analysis, as well as logging the lot in use.
— Any interferences, for example, from bilirubinemia, lipaemia and hemolysis, must be documented for the analysis.

— This is based on Thermo Fischer Scientific Norge AS being the only supplier that can perform the delivery in accordance with the requirements. The intention notice is pursuant to the public procurement regulations § 21-5. The terms in FOA § 13-4 (2) and 13-1 (5) are deemed to be fulfilled as well as the value of the full service contract for the instrument´s lifetime.

TITLE.P: 75179 AS KLM Avd for medisinsk biokjemi [The Department of Medical Biochemistry], Analysis Machine.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The waiting period is ten days (due to public holidays, we have added days).
